alert.note: Alert for Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 2:16PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN PIKE COUNTY THROUGH 245 PM CDT... At 215 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Antioch, or near Brundidge, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Troy, Brundidge, Banks, Antioch, Tennille, Brundidge Municipal Airport, Hamilton Crossroads, Mossy Grove, and Monticello. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
